text: the Martian is hailed for its scientific
accuracy the author even went so far as
to write his own computer software to
calculate the paths of spaceships the
movie strives for this realism but it
got some stuff totally wrong here are a
few of those mark Watney is stranded on
Mars on a powerful dust storm rolls
through the area threatening to topple
over their spaceship the crew freaks out
mark gets blown away they get in the
spaceship and leave them for dead the
problem here is that Mars has about 1%
the atmosphere that Earth has it's
basically a vacuum on the surface 100
mile per hour wind on earth could do
some serious damage but on Mars it would
basically blow a plastic bag around
there's just really no way this could be
any threat to a space mission mark
Watney is stranded on Mars for more than
500 days this is a big issue because
Mars has no protection from solar or
cosmic radiation on earth we have an
atmosphere and a big magnetic field to
move the stuff around us or absorb it
Mars doesn't have that luxury if you are
stranded on Mars you're gonna want some
kind of shielding to protect you from
the stuff it's really dangerous when
Hwanhee finally gets in touch with NASA
they have a nice instantaneous text
message conversation the problem here is
that Mars is a hundred and forty million
miles away from Earth even at the speed
of light it takes 12 minutes for a
message from Earth to get to Mars and
another 12 minutes for it to get from
Mars back to earth so a conversation
with a Martian would be really drawn out
in painstaking in an effort not to
starve Mark Watney a trained botanist
besides to grow his own food with water
he makes the Ray complicated process of
burning rocket fuel and surprise it's
insanely dangerous he almost blows
himself up the crazy part is NASA is
known about frozen water in the Martian
soil for years
why he could have dug some of this up
melted it and used that to grow his
plants no need for crazy science
experiments inside a highly flammable
habitat while Hollywood did make some
glaring scientific missteps they did get
a lot right and it's still a really
great movie so we applaud the filmmakers
for finally squeezing some real actual
science into the science fiction genre
